Career Profile

My research domain is highly related to obtaining efficient neural networks by applying compression techniques, such as quantization, pruning, and distillation, for deployment of the networks on edge devices.

Publications

Centralized Quantization: Preserving a Few Large Weights to Relieve theDegradation in Accuracy by Ternary Weights
Jinbae Park, Sung-Ho Bae
[Submitted]
Distilling Global and Local Logits with Densely Connected Relations

Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF International Conference on Computer Vision (ICCV), 2021
Search for Optimal Data Augmentation Policy for Environmental Sound Classification with Deep Neural Networks
Jinbae Park, Teerath Kumar, Sung-Ho Bae
Journal of Broadcast Engineering (JBE), 25.6, 2020

Projects

A Study on Compression of Deep Neural Networks by Quantization and Pruning
IITP, Republic of KoreaJan 2021 - Dec 2021
Deployment of lightened networks on edge devices, such as Google Pixel 3, Raspberry Pi 4, and Nvidia Jetson Xavier NX.
Deep Model Compression based on Joint Learning for Vision Applications
IITP, Republic of KoreaAug 2020 - Dec 2020
4th place prize in the challenge.

IITP, Republic of KoreaSept 2019 - Dec 2020

Experience

Compression of the Regression Models for Face Landmark Detection
Research internship, Hyprsense Inc., USASept 2018 - Jan 2019
Building a compressed cascaded regression model with the sparsification of docomposed weight matrices by L1 based regularization methods.
Developing of C Program for Accelerating Convolutional Neural Networks on FPGA boards
Research assistant, Prof. Nikil Dutt, University of California Irvine, USAJun 2018 - Oct 2018
Optimizing C programs of CNN models with Vivado HLS to deploy on FPGA boards.
Swapping Face and Facial Expressions of People
Research internship, Alchera Inc., Republic of KoreaJan 2018 - Feb 2018
Changing face and facial expressions of different people using the extracted face landmarks.
